reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long beautiful drive through the hills we were instantly impressed with the Grand Hotel. We received a very warm greeting from friendly staff and a nice cup of tea. Our room was huge and charming with a lovely modern bathroom, very comfortable bed and great views of the pretty garden. We went to the Indian restaurant for lunch and it was so nice we went back for dinner!! The bar was really nice and we played snooker in a quaint room next to the bar. Breakfast was delicious - very good choice of fruit, waffles etc... This is one of our favourite hotels in Sri Lanka, we enjoyed the old English charm (and cooler weather!) together with the Sri Lankan hospitality and food.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with lots of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the architectural style and the decoration of the common areas is really charming (almost over the top, but still charming). Unfortunately, the rooms are in desperate need for some updating, specially the bathrooms.
reviews.title: Charming, but so-so

reviews.text: We had dinner at the Indian restaurant, outside of the hotel but owned by it. Food was simple, but delicious, plentiful and very cheap. The next morning, breakfast in the main restaurant was excellent... both the food and the decoration were lavish!
reviews.title: Old Colonial Charm

reviews.text: It seems that the hotel has a top location in the town of Nuwara Eliya, but we didn't find much to do outside. It's important to have a driver to visit the tea fields and factories, which are nice.
reviews.title: A step back in time!

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights during my recent Sri Lanka tour. This hotel is situated in a mock tudor building and it has lots of character. The rooms have high ceilings and an old-world colonial charm about them, but at he same time the bathrooms are spacious and modern. The food at the main restaurant is a bit pricey at 3000 rupees for the dinner buffet, but of an excellent standard. The breakfasts are also very good.
reviews.title: Fascinating colonial hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a disappointment, an odd welcome with a cup of tea, then shown to a small room with a huge bathroom. After the long drive from Kandy we wanted a pool. The Rough Guide describes this hotel well, as plucked from any golf course in the Home Counties in the U.K. There is a great deal of dark wood, it may be “Little England”, but the whole place was oppressive. The staff were not particularly friendly and the corridors were full of luggage from coaches dumping loads of tourists for one night. Due to some mix up over our vouchers we were being charged for dinner which was included. After showing our booking sheet the reception said the manager would call us, nothing happened. It took the efforts of our driver to sort it out while reception made no effort to be of assistance. ( Jetwing Beach Negombo the same experience was quietly resolved by reception who made 1 phone call on our behalf)
reviews.title: Avoid, but the food is good

reviews.text: The food was exceptional in the evening, but we struggled to comprehend breakfast routine as there was not the usual spread but 2 cooks preparing food, but a queue at both. The town, a short walk away was unimpressive, a busy bus station, one main street and that’s it. The are other hotels in this town try to avoid this one.
reviews.title: Hill Country stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Nuwara Eliya hoping the Grand would be a nice place to stay and were not disappointed at all. The hotel was doing some renovations but it did not intrude at all. We were in the governors wing in a twin room and it was just lovely. There was plenty of room, the beds and pillows were very comfortable and for the first time we were in licensed premises so we did not have to "bring our own".
reviews.title: Grand, grand, grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and courteous and when we needed assistance to call a doctor for a rather nasty insect bite, they were able to do this quickly efficiently and the doctor was great. He even went back to the town and procured the antibiotics for us and brought them back. The price was very reasonable considering the personal service offered however the cost was not a primary consideration at the time.
reviews.title: super hotel- location, food, heritage and weather

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had drinks in the bar and the Brandy Alexanders are really yummy. The restaurant had a lovely buffet and the food was beautiful.
reviews.title: The Presidential suite for us!

reviews.text: My family was upgraded to a suite (I guess they were fully booked) with two rooms. It was old charm but was very clean. The food in the buffet was fantastic. They served great Thai and Malaysian food - and coming from that part of the world, the food was good :)
reviews.title: I loved it except for the noise.

reviews.text: I would have given this a 5 star rating, but the way they handled my complaint on the noise was subpar. I called to complain and they couldnt tell me why it was noisy - telling me several reasons like the Supper Club and the Golf Club. I asked if they could so something about it. They said NO! I asked if I could talk to the manager, they said they don't have one! I had to go down, in my pajamas no less, to pressure the manager to come out.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: Too bad, a service fluke for such a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: AWFUL, NAUSEATING, FILTHY AND REPULSIVE - A COMPLETE NO NO!

reviews.text: We stayed there for 2 nights starting with Christmas Eve.
reviews.title: old world charm!!

reviews.text: The hotel was well decorated, looked charming. Felt quite grand! I am used to staying in 5 star properties all the time travelling on business, so this was a good change. A nice boutique hotel, not one of the cookie-cutter chain hotels. Had a personality and history.
reviews.title: Large and impressive hotel, good evening buffet but a bit on the chilly side in the bedroom!

reviews.text: Grand colonial hotel but expect, which usually goes along with this kind of old-world-charm establishment, noise from above and neighbours. Our rooms on the 1st floor are OK with spacious and modernized bathrooms. The TV was not really working and in late December they failed to provide extra blankets. The heater wasn't too helpful at all but it's better than none during the night. We could hear every single word our neighbour said next door, until, apparently noting that we could hear him loud and clear, stopped his phone conversation. We were there for 2 nights and were sort of lucky that on both nights different neighbours had been considerable by trying to lower their noise level. can't imagine if they didn't.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, but noisy
Rooms need major refurbishment
reviews.text: Other than the above the hotel is lovely. Service is adequate, real nice gardening, buffet is great, so is the location. Bearing in mind the noise level I probably won't stay here again.

I spent 2 nights here last Christmas. Building and decor have a colonial feel. Nice manicured garden, quite photogenic. Beautiful public area--pretty x'mas decoration. Buffet dinners were theme-based. We had Mexican food for one night and Indian for another, meaning, 90% hot and spicy and a just few choices that suited regular palate. I bet the next theme would be Sichuan cuisine from China--super hot!! Our choices were really very limited. Generally, lack of waiters. Our room was of acceptable standard but with a no. of cons: 1. noise insulation was nil. I heard distinctly TV dialogues from adjacent room and what my neighbor ordered for room service (ie tuna sandwich and tea). I knew when the occupant above me took a shower... Thought there was a downpour out there... 2. My TV had an irritating high-pitch echo while on, so I had to turn it off after a minute. 3. Kettle socket went dead. Luckily, I brought my own travel kettle. 4. Shower cubicle was tiny and claustrophobic. The hotel probably has to close down for a year for major renovation to guarantee 4-star comfort.
reviews.title: A true heritage hotel.

reviews.text: All in all, stay in this hotel for its character and lovely garden. Don't expect too much for room comfort,
reviews.title: 4 star namesake.. avoid it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in Dec 2011.The entire hotel has a very festive feel to it. hWe were welcomed with a very nice warm cup of tea.and were given the biggest room in the hotel. this room has 2 windows on adjacent walls providing us a great view of the hotel lawns below. The hotel has very pretty well landscaped lawns. The breakfast buffet is a good spread and the food is good. Being a heritage hotel this hotel has the colonial old world charm about it which was pleasantly different.
reviews.title: Grand? Hmmmm.
